snippet: The move comes just days before an Aug. 17 deadline that Europe’s competition authorities had set for Google to respond to the accusations.
abstract: European Commission extends Google's deadline to answer claims that it favored its own comparison shopping search over those of rivals until end of August; European officials and antitrust lawyers say company's move to reorganize its business units under new name Alphabet will not affect antitrust case.

byline.original: By MARK SCOTT and CONOR DOUGHERTY

lead_paragraph: The move comes just days before an Aug. 17 deadline that Europe’s competition authorities had set for Google to respond to the accusations.

headline.main: Europe Gives Google More Time to Respond to Antitrust Charges
headline.print_headline: More Time for Google to Answer Europeans
